intro: Leonohebe benthamii, commonly known as the bentham's leonohebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
